title: Can anyone please tell me...
content:
what typeface Martin Kvamme used in this design?

[http://www.nrk.no/lydverket/wp-content/uploads/2008/02/mike-patton\_poste...](http://web.archive.org/web/20130317140108/http:/www.nrk.no/lydverket/wp-content/uploads/2008/02/mike-patton_poster_oslo.jpg "http://www.nrk.no/lydverket/wp-content/uploads/2008/02/mike-patton\_poster\_oslo.jpg")
author: marenhei

comments.content: I think he messed about with Hoefler Text. Other options: [Farnham Display](http://web.archive.org/web/20130317140108/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/font_bureau/farnham_display_italic/), [Adobe Caslon](http://web.archive.org/web/20130317140108/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/adobe_caslon_pro_bold_italic/?sample_text=See%20swashes%20below.&acs_ss=20).

This definitely started out as Adobe Caslon Italic with swashes. The simpler characters like ‘e’, ‘n’, ‘a’ (which he left alone) are the clue. Dead giveaways: the ampersand and the alternate ‘w’ in ‘Norway’.
